content.webTitle: Virgin Mobile chief to quit after NTL merger

fields.headline: Virgin Mobile chief to quit after NTL merger
fields.bodyText: Virgin Mobile's co-founder and chief executive, Tom Alexander, said yesterday he would leave when the business merged with NTL in July. Mr Alexander, who is set to collect about £5m from the takeover, planned to "go out and play" once the deal was done. "I've got cars I've never driven, a family I hardly ever see and a house in France I hardly ever get to visit," he said. He wanted to inform staff of the new team as soon as possible to ensure a smooth transition. The finance head, Alan Gow, will be managing director with Joe Steel, commercial director, who co-founded the business, as his deputy.
